content:
• Tuesday, May 28, 2013
  • GWRE

    More on Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ3 beats across the board as total sales rose 20% from...

    More on Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ3 beats across the board as total sales rose 20% from the prior year period. Services revenue, its largest top-line contributor, jumped 31%, while license revenue grew 5.8% and maintenance by 19%. Net earnings swung to a loss however, as operating expenses also rose by 30%, including a 30% increase in R&D spending and a 42% jump in sales and marketing costs. Shares +7.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 PM
  • PWRD

    More on Perfect World: Q1 revenue was $100.6M (-13% Y/Y), beating consensus by $2.8M. Q2...

    More on Perfect World: Q1 revenue was $100.6M (-13% Y/Y), beating consensus by $2.8M. Q2 guidance is for revenue of RMB656M-RMB687M ($105.6M-$110.6M), above a consensus of $102.5M. Online game revenue (89% of total) -16% Y/Y (share loss to Tencent and NetEase); average concurrent game users fell 11% Q/Q and 31% Y/Y to 554K. Gross margin was 76.5%, -40 bps Q/Q and -580 bps Y/Y. Opex -3% Y/Y. PWRD +3.9% AH, CC at 9PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • GWRE

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:45 p.m.: GWRE +5.7%. WLH +4.7%. WTSL +4.2%. IVC +4.1%. MYGN...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:45 p.m.: GWRE +5.7%. WLH +4.7%. WTSL +4.2%. IVC +4.1%. MYGN +3.8%.
    After-hours top losers: OTC:PRXI -5.2%. BKS -4.6%. PXP -4.2%. IRC -3.4%. AEC -2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM
  • PWRD

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q1 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.02. Shares +3.1% AH. (PR)

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q1 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.02. Shares +3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ +5.1% AH after announcing the Nasdaq will allow it to remain listed, provided it becomes...

    OCZ +5.1% AH after announcing the Nasdaq will allow it to remain listed, provided it becomes current with its SEC filings by Sept. 16. The SSD vendor had received a delisting notice on April 15 after failing to meet an April 8 filing deadline. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • WTSL

    More on Wet Seal's (NASDAQ:WTSL) Q1: CEO John Goodman says management "has effectively...

    More on Wet Seal's (NASDAQ:WTSL) Q1: CEO John Goodman says management "has effectively stabilized the business." Comps breakdown: Namesake, -3.4%; Arden B., +0.9%; overall, -2.9%. Inventory per square foot falls 7.7% Y/Y, cash and cash equivalents total $111.7M (no debt), and share repurchases totaled 1.207M during the period. Outlook: Q2 EPS of $0-0.02/ share on revenue of $138-141M (consensus is -$0.02/share on $132.06M), mid-single digit comps growth, and margin expansion of 600-700 basis points. Shares +4.89% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • WTSL

    Wet Seal (NASDAQ:WTSL): Q1 EPS of $0.01 in-line. Revenue of $140.4M beats by $3.2M. Shares +4.9%...

    Wet Seal (NASDAQ:WTSL): Q1 EPS of $0.01 in-line. Revenue of $140.4M beats by $3.2M. Shares +4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • VIPS

    Vipshop (VIPS -12.9%) responds to a bearish Friday column from SA contributor Greenwich Research...

    Vipshop (VIPS -12.9%) responds to a bearish Friday column from SA contributor Greenwich Research Group. Among other things, Greenwich questioned Vipshop's revenue growth claims in light of Alexa data showing much slower unique visitor growth, and declares the Chinese online retailer's high gross margin (950 bps higher than DANG's in Q4) and low fulfillment costs hard to believe. Vipshop responds by claiming its revenue growth is fueled in part by active customer growth and bigger orders, and that its growing use of regional/local couriers has helped lower fulfillment costs. Shares were hammered today by a downgrade to Hold from Deutsche.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • GWRE

    Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ3 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $68.3M (+20% Y/Y)...

    Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ3 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $68.3M (+20% Y/Y) beats by $4.7M. Shares +6.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • JEC

    Jacobs Engineering (JEC +2.6%) finishes the day higher after the company announced earlier that...

    Jacobs Engineering (JEC +2.6%) finishes the day higher after the company announced earlier that it was awarded a contract by Magnox Limited to provide project management resources in support of the company's decommissioning program in the United Kingdom. No details of the contract were disclosed, but the Project Management Resource Partnership agreement is an extension of a transfer protocol that was established with JEC in 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • KTCC

    Key Tronic (KTCC +2.8%) says that it intends to purchase Sabre Manufacturing for approximately...

    Key Tronic (KTCC +2.8%) says that it intends to purchase Sabre Manufacturing for approximately $5.1M in cash. Sabre is a sheet metal fabrication company that operates a 66K-square foot facility near the Key Tronic campus in Juarez, Mexico. The transaction is anticipated to close in July and to be immediately accretive to earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • HL

    The takeover of Aurizon Mines (AZK -15.3%) by Hecla Mining (HL +1.1%) is approved by Canada's...

    The takeover of Aurizon Mines (AZK -15.3%) by Hecla Mining (HL +1.1%) is approved by Canada's Minister of Industry and Minister of State. Closing is anticipated to occur on June 1.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • SHPG

    ViroPharma (VPHM +2.6%) gains after releasing positive results from trials of its Cinryze, a...

    ViroPharma (VPHM +2.6%) gains after releasing positive results from trials of its Cinryze, a therapy approved for routine prevention of angioedema attacks in patients with hereditary forms of the disease. The study showed a 54.7% decrease in attack rate for those patients treated with Cinryze over the period, which is similar to the reduction in attack rate (52%) from the overall study population.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • NBY

    NovaBay Pharmaceuticals (NBY +2.8%) enters into a collaboration and license agreement with...

    NovaBay Pharmaceuticals (NBY +2.8%) enters into a collaboration and license agreement with veterinary product company Virbac, giving it exclusive worldwide rights to develop NBY's compound auriclosene for global veterinary markets. Under the terms of the agreement, NBY will receive an option exercise fee as well as development and pre-commercial milestone payments as a result of the collaboration. The company also expects to receive royalties on the sale of any commercial products in the companion animal field.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • CDZI

    Cadiz (CDZI +5.5%) trades higher after a California court rejects a lawsuit challenging the...

    Cadiz (CDZI +5.5%) trades higher after a California court rejects a lawsuit challenging the approval of its Cadiz Valley Water Conservation, Recovery and Storage Project. The lawsuit, brought by interest group CROWN, was filed in August 2012 and was the second lawsuit challenging the approval of the project to be dismissed.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • HMA

    Glenview Capital claims it does not intend to bid for Health Management (HMA +5.2%), which...

    Glenview Capital claims it does not intend to bid for Health Management (HMA +5.2%), which recently adopted a poison pill apparently in response to Glenview's conversion of its Schedule 13G filing (disclosing a 14.6% stake) to a Schedule 13D. "We wish to clarify that [we] have made no proposals, either to HMA or to any of its holdings," Glenview says

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • CSX

    Shares of CSX (CSX -0.7%) slump into negative territory after reports come in that a train...

    Shares of CSX (CSX -0.7%) slump into negative territory after reports come in that a train derailment in Maryland is tied to the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 4 Comments
  • Z

    More on Goldman's upgrade of Trulia (TRLA +5.1%): Analyst Debra Schwartz argues an improving...

    More on Goldman's upgrade of Trulia (TRLA +5.1%): Analyst Debra Schwartz argues an improving growth outlook fueled by an improving housing market justifies a valuation of 20x 2014E EV/EBITDA. She also notes Trulia trades at an 18% EV/sales discount to Zillow (Z +1%) after being pressured recently by a stock offering and lockup expiration, and that comScore estimates PC unique visitor growth rose to 32% Y/Y in April from 30% in March (mobile growth is much stronger). The Market Leader acquisition is seen increasing Trulia's paying agent share and providing new upselling opportunities.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • BMY

    More from Jefferies' "proprietary sum of the parts analysis" of big pharma: Price target on...

    More from Jefferies' "proprietary sum of the parts analysis" of big pharma: Price target on Bristol Myers Squibb (BMY +0.7%) raised to $53.50 from $45, Buy rating reiterated; price target on Johnson & Johnson (JNJ +0.6%) raised to $97 from $90, reiterated at Hold; AbbVie (ABBV -0.5%) reiterated at Buy, price target raised to $54 from $51; Novartis (NVS -1.5%) is "top European pick"; price target for Abbott (ABT +1.3%), the "top U.S. pick", is raised to $46 from $43. (More big pharma: DB upgrades GSK)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • MAKO

    Shares in Mako Surgical (MAKO +11.3%) move up today on heavy volume, pushing up towards the top...

    Shares in Mako Surgical (MAKO +11.3%) move up today on heavy volume, pushing up towards the top of a channel its's traded in for most of this year after Wells Fargo ups their rating to Outperform from Market Perform. Wells thinks that MAKO’s new hip software for its RIO robot addresses concerns that have limited its adoption since launching in September 2011. The firm expects hip procedure growth, which represents a significantly large percentage of its projected revenue stream, should accelerate following the release of the software around July.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • SEII

    Investors made an "epic miscalculation" in tripling Cleantech's (CLNT -13.8%) share price last...

    Investors made an "epic miscalculation" in tripling Cleantech's (CLNT -13.8%) share price last week after news the company had become a "certified supplier" to Chinese energy giants Sinopec and China National Petroleum, Richard Pearson writes. The result, he says, will be the return to a $3-$4 stock price soon; if CLNT hopes to take advantage to raise $5M in a stock offering, it had better get moving.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine (CPST +13%) moves up today after saying it's received a significant order from...

    Capstone Turbine (CPST +13%) moves up today after saying it's received a significant order from New York-based Related Companies for an undisclosed amount. The initial order includes multiple Capstone C65 and C200 Dual Mode microturbines that are projected to be installed over the next two years in several new office buildings, apartments, and mixed-use properties.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 7 Comments
  • NLY

    Growing thoughts of a tapering and then ending of QE∞ triggers panicky selling in the...

    Growing thoughts of a tapering and then ending of QE∞ triggers panicky selling in the mREIT sector (MORT -2.3%) as Treasury yields hit their highest level in more than a year (the 10-year at 2.12%), and mortgage prices slide as well (MBB -0.4%). Leading the way is a 5.3% decline in American Capital Agency. Annaly (NLY -2.7%), Two Harbors (TWO -3%), Anworth (ANH -2.2%), Western Asset (WMC -4.7%), Apollo Residential (AMTG -3.7%), Javelin (JMI -4.3%), Invesco (IVR -1.8%), MFA Financial (MFA -1.5%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 83 Comments
  • BLDP

    Shares of Ballard Power (BLDP +17%) rally again today, racking up a 40% gain just since last...

    Shares of Ballard Power (BLDP +17%) rally again today, racking up a 40% gain just since last Thursday. It's worth noting that he stock has been a powerhouse lately, soaring over 185% since the beginning of the year. TheStreet.com contributor Roberto Pedone notes the stock as one of his top five picks under $5 that is "set to soar."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • WD

    Hit by a flurry of insider sales (as lockups expired) over the past couple of months, Walker...

    Hit by a flurry of insider sales (as lockups expired) over the past couple of months, Walker & Dunlop (WD +2%) gets a boost from a big buy, with Fortress Investment Group (FIG +2.9%) disclosing the upping of its stake from about 33% to nearly 40%. "I guess Wes Edens likes their business model," tweets Dynex Capital (NYSE:DX) CEO and hedge funder Tom Akin.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 1 Comment

  • Heavy selling hits a number of Pimco income funds, notably the High Income Fund (PHK -4.3%) with...

    Heavy selling hits a number of Pimco income funds, notably the High Income Fund (PHK -4.3%) with heavy exposure to high-yield paper and the financial sector. The decline narrows the fund's premium to NAV to a still-whopping 34%. The Income Opportunity Common Fund (PKO -2.2%) trades at just a slight premium, while the Dynamic Income Fund (PDI -2.8%) sells for about a 5% discount. Others: (PTY -3.6%), (PCN -2%), (PGP -5.3%), (PFN -1.5%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • TIF

    Heard during Tiffany's (TIF +3.6%) earnings call: 1) The higher-than-expected sales tally was...

    Heard during Tiffany's (TIF +3.6%) earnings call: 1) The higher-than-expected sales tally was driven by a strong performance late in the quarter. 2) On store count, Tiffany's says it ended the quarter with 275 company-owned stores and plans to open another 16 this year - including 4 in China. 3) The Great Gatsby brand helped provide a sales bump, even though the quarter ended before the movie with the tie-in debuted. 4) The company says it will likely keep a dividend payout ratio in the high 30s. 5) No Q&A as the retailer goes with the pre-recorded call format. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • RBBN

    Sonus (SONS +5.4%) jumps after announcing a hardware/software partnership with Juniper (JNPR...

    Sonus (SONS +5.4%) jumps after announcing a hardware/software partnership with Juniper (JNPR +1.1%) that covers the networking industry's favorite buzzphrase, software-defined networking. Sonus' 5000 series VoIP session border controllers (SBCs) will be paired with Juniper's MX Series edge routers and SRC Policy Engine software to give carriers the ability to offertiered IP video and unified communications services, as well as more efficiently use network capacity. The announcement comes a couple weeks after Sonus, which competes with Oracle-owned Acme Packet in the SBC market, refreshed the 5000 series to include more modular systems.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • VRTB

    Midday top 10 gainers: VRTB +23%. PIP +21%. LSE +20%. CSIQ +19%. HSOL +18%. HYGS +17%. BLDP...

    Midday top 10 gainers: VRTB +23%. PIP +21%. LSE +20%. CSIQ +19%. HSOL +18%. HYGS +17%. BLDP +16%. OBCI +13%. SVA +14%. UACL +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: ENOC -19%. FSGI -13%. RSOL -12%. OXBT -12%. HGSH -11%. BDL -10%. CLNT -10%. VIPS -9%. RPI -9%. ZIOP -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN -6.4%) trades lower on negative comments out of Summer Street this morning, saying...

    Amarin (AMRN -6.4%) trades lower on negative comments out of Summer Street this morning, saying that Vascepa might not be as key as previously thought. The firm notes that a member of AMRN's steering committee presented at a primary care conference last week, and said there was no reason to give Vascepa to patients with triglycerides <500 mg/dL until the outcome of current trials are completed, and, even if approval is granted early, sales are likely to disappoint.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 8 Comments
  • LLNW

    Limelight (LLNW +6.3%) "is in talks to try and sell the company to Verizon (NYSE:VZ) and is...

    Limelight (LLNW +6.3%) "is in talks to try and sell the company to Verizon (NYSE:VZ) and is desperate to make a deal," Dan Rayburn reports hearing from "multiple attendees from Wall Street" at a conference he hosted. With Limelight burning cash and facing tough competition from Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) and Level 3 (NASDAQ:LVLT), there's logic to exploring a sale. Rayburn points out Limelight's management changes and Verizon's interest in growing its CDN business could lead to a deal. However, he adds Limelight has been seeing employee defections, and has heard Limelight customers criticize the "poor performance" of its CDN. Private XO Communications is also said to be talking with Limelight.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +2.5%) gets a lift from positive comments out of Piper's Charles Duncan today. He...

    Vivus (VVUS +2.5%) gets a lift from positive comments out of Piper's Charles Duncan today. He thinks Vivus could find a partner for Qsymia before year-end, as the weight loss medication racks up more gains as reduced REMS restrictions lead to broader pharmacy access. The firm reiterates its Overweight rating on the shares with a $20 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 3 Comments
  • EXC

    As stocks move broadly higher, utilities (NYSEARCA:XLU) lag following downgrades of Exelon (EXC...

    As stocks move broadly higher, utilities (NYSEARCA:XLU) lag following downgrades of Exelon (EXC -7.1%) and First Energy (FE -6.7%) by Deutsche Bank based on "the ugly reality of the 2016-17 RPM auction results." The firm sees downside in all integrated power names as the "uncertain path to a power market recovery forces investors to reconsider the multiples paid for commodity cyclical power generation assets." (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 4 Comments
  • HLIT

    Harmonic (HLIT +3%) rises on news it will repurchase ~12M shares at $6.25 each, representing a...

    Harmonic (HLIT +3%) rises on news it will repurchase ~12M shares at $6.25 each, representing a 2.4% premium to Friday's close. (Previously: HLIT to buy back shares in Dutch auction)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • HSTM

    HealthStream (HSTM +5.1%) gets a bump higher today after Avondale Partners ups the shares to...

    HealthStream (HSTM +5.1%) gets a bump higher today after Avondale Partners ups the shares to Market Perform on valuation and raised its price target from $25 to $31. The stock has been on a tear, gaining over 33% since mid-April and, at least at present, appears to be getting some added juice from the retest of a near-term technical high.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • SNBR

    Piper Jaffray raises its price target on Select Comfort (SCSS +5.1%) to $28 from $23 citing...

    Piper Jaffray raises its price target on Select Comfort (SCSS +5.1%) to $28 from $23 citing store checks. The company could see near-term outperformance as it runs up against easier compares and as the new DualTemp product provides a 2-4% comps boost.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • NEPT

    Neptune Technologies & Bioresources (NEPT +6.2%) jumps after saying it has begun...

    Neptune Technologies & Bioresources (NEPT +6.2%) jumps after saying it has begun reconstruction of production facilities in Quebec earlier than expected (FQ1 as opposed to FQ2). The company expects to complete the project by the end of FY14 and says the new facility will be capable of producing 150K+ kilos of krill oil per year. (See also: Class action suit dismissed)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings (SHLD -2.3%) trades lower as sentiment stays muted following the retailer's...

    Sears Holdings (SHLD -2.3%) trades lower as sentiment stays muted following the retailer's disappointing Q1 earnings report. SA contributer Paulo Santos ran Sears Holdings through the rigorous Altman Z-Score to find the risk of insolvency at Sears puts it in a category where "dramatic action" may be required to effect survival according to the model. Does Eddie Lampert have anything up his sleeve that could jumpstart a turnaround?
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 6 Comments
  • DOLE

    Dole Food (DOLE -6.1%) craters after suspending the $200M share repurchase program it announced...

    Dole Food (DOLE -6.1%) craters after suspending the $200M share repurchase program it announced earlier this month. The company has decided to purchase three new refrigerated container ships instead for $165M, replacing three existing ships which are nearly three decades old. DOLE also says it expects "full-year losses in [the] strawberry business to be ~$23M below plan." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • AMZN

    Amazon (AMZN +3.3%), eBay (EBAY +2.4%), and Overstock (OSTK +5.1%) outperform after May's...

    Amazon (AMZN +3.3%), eBay (EBAY +2.4%), and Overstock (OSTK +5.1%) outperform after May's consumer confidence print comes in at 76.1, well above a consensus of 71.5. Amazon and eBay rallied 11 days ago in response to strong mid-May consumer sentiment data.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • GNVC

    GenVec (GNVC -40%) gets slammed this morning after its board votes to approve the liquidation...

    GenVec (GNVC -40%) gets slammed this morning after its board votes to approve the liquidation and dissolution of the company, saying it's in the best interests of its stockholders. The dissolution plan, which still requires shareholder approval, may be abandoned if circumstances change. After a dismal Q4 report, the company ended the year with just $15.3M in cash and equivalants, and forecast a 2013 cash burn between $8M and $9M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • FET

    Forum Energy Tech (FET +2.8%) agrees to buy Germany-based Blohm+Voss Oil Tools, a provider of...

    Forum Energy Tech (FET +2.8%) agrees to buy Germany-based Blohm+Voss Oil Tools, a provider of pipe-handling equipment for use on onshore and offshore rigs, from P-E fund Star Capital Partners for an undisclosed sum. FET CEO Cris Gaut says the deal "significantly strengthens the tubular handling offering within our drilling technologies product line."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -4.5%) slumps after releasing all 15 episodes of Season 4 of Arrested Development...

    Netflix (NFLX -4.5%) slumps after releasing all 15 episodes of Season 4 of Arrested Development over the weekend (following a 7-year break) to mixed reviews, at best. "If you truly loved [the first 3 seasons], it's hard to imagine being anything but disappointed with this new rendition," writes the NYT's Mike Hale. The WSJ's Nathan Rabin: "The pacing is notably slower than during its original run and the show lacks the breathtaking density that characterized its glorious past." The LA Times' Robert Lloyd is more positive. "I have ... watched it all – and not with grim determination, but rather great, increasing satisfaction." (The Daily Beast) (The Guardian)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 12 Comments
  • CSIQ

    2013's giant solar stock rally continues (TAN +3.9%) as the EU faces a backlash over Chinese...

    2013's giant solar stock rally continues (TAN +3.9%) as the EU faces a backlash over Chinese tariff proposals, and Canadian Solar (CSIQ +15.2%) soundly beats Q1 estimates with the help of a 470 bps Q/Q increase in gross margin to 9.7%. Though CSIQ's opex would only have fallen 3% Y/Y if not for the reversal of a $30M arbitration award, it still fell 17% Q/Q (exc. one-time events) thanks to 25% Q/Q drop in selling expenses. Also: CSIQ is guiding for module shipments to rise to 380MW-410MW in Q2 from Q1's 340MW, and (like JA Solar) is seeing surging Japanese shipments - they rose 76% Q/Q in Q1, and made up 25% of total shipments. TSL +8.4%. JKS +4.6%. YGE +6.9%. LDK +4.8%. DQ +7%. SCTY +2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • F

    Shares of Ford (F +3.4%) rev higher as any concerns about an USTA investigation over...

    Shares of Ford (F +3.4%) rev higher as any concerns about an USTA investigation over acceleration issue with F-150 pickup trucks gets left in the dust. The focus of investors seems to be on a price target increase from Merrill Lynch to $24 and more bullish forecasts for demand in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • OXY

    Occidental Petroleum (OXY +2.7%) could be worth $150/share if its Middle East and North Africa...

    Occidental Petroleum (OXY +2.7%) could be worth $150/share if its Middle East and North Africa unit were split from its Americas business, BAML analyst Doug Leggate believes, maintaining his Buy rating and $120 price target for now. Breakup talk has been growing since CEO Steve Chazen strengthened his grip on the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • RCPI

    Shares of Star Scientific (STSI +11.9%) rip a double-digit gain as M&A chatter picks up...

    Shares of Star Scientific (STSI +11.9%) rip a double-digit gain as M&A chatter picks up again. The dietary supplement maker has been beaten down this year with a few controversies, but shares are poking their head above $1.60 for the first time in over a month.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • GPT

    It's a Barron's bounce for Gramercy Property Trust (GPT +5.5%) as the magazine suggests the easy...

    It's a Barron's bounce for Gramercy Property Trust (GPT +5.5%) as the magazine suggests the easy money has been made on its Capmark Financial Group (CPMK.PK) recommendation and an analyst at a value shop suggests investors roll their gains into another turnaround play - Gramercy (well-chronicled on Seeking Alpha). A re-institution of the dividend could take the shares to $6.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 3 Comments
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems, now known as B456 Systems (OTC:AONEQ) expects its Joint Plan of Liquidation to...

    A123 Systems, now known as B456 Systems (OTC:AONEQ) expects its Joint Plan of Liquidation to become effective at some point after June 10 and "upon the satisfaction or waiver of certain conditions precedent." Last week, B456 won court approval for its plan to exit bankruptcy by selling off its assets. Shares +4.35% but down from earlier highs. (8-K filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 5 Comments
  • Z

    Trulia (TRLA +6.8%) gets a lift from a Goldman upgrade to Buy from Neutral (price target raised...

    Trulia (TRLA +6.8%) gets a lift from a Goldman upgrade to Buy from Neutral (price target raised to $38 from $33).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • CUR

    Neuralstem (NYSEMKT:CUR) says a study shows that rats transplanted with NSI-566, human neural...

    Neuralstem (NYSEMKT:CUR) says a study shows that rats transplanted with NSI-566, human neural stem cells that the company derives from the spinal chord, experienced "improvement along several measures of motor function and a reduction of spasticity." Neuralstem shares +1.4%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • VER
